### extractModifierFromExpr {#abe0e36a051010675ec1289bf6bdc482f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const MCExpr &#42; VEAsmParser::extractModifierFromExpr (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcexpr">MCExpr</a> &#42; E, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/vemcexpr/#af04d361a436f54db54865f22611d8844">VEMCExpr::VariantKind</a> &amp; Variant)</>}>
Extract.

<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">@lo32/@hi32/etc </span></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>
 modifier from expression. Recursively scan the expression and check for VK&#95;VE&#95;HI32/LO32/etc symbol variants. If all symbols with modifier use the same variant, return the corresponding <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/vemcexpr/#af04d361a436f54db54865f22611d8844">VEMCExpr::VariantKind</a>, and a modified expression using the default symbol variant. Otherwise, return NULL.

### parseDirective {#a0533034675b1b5d80cd5d5da950458bc}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ParseStatus VEAsmParser::parseDirective (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/asmtoken">AsmToken</a> DirectiveID)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Parses a target-specific assembler directive.

The parser is positioned following the directive name. The target-specific directive parser should parse the entire directive doing or recording any target-specific work, or emit an error. On success, the entire line should be parsed up to and including the end-of-statement token. On failure, the parser is not required to read to the end of the line. If the directive is not target-specific, no tokens should be consumed and NoMatch is returned.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="DirectiveID">- The token identifying the directive.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/ve/lib/target/ve/asmparser/veasmparser-cpp/#l00061">61</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/ve/lib/target/ve/asmparser/veasmparser-cpp">VEAsmParser.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

ParseExpression.

This differs from the default &quot;parseExpression&quot; in that it handles modifiers.

### parseInstruction {#aaddbf4f65977588cfa20fc2bef021672}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool VEAsmParser::parseInstruction (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/parseinstructioninfo">ParseInstructionInfo</a> &amp; Info, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Name, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smloc">SMLoc</a> NameLoc, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a61e27c75c3334cffa54c44c02077da1e">OperandVector</a> &amp; Operands)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Parse one assembly instruction.

The parser is positioned following the instruction name. The target specific instruction parser should parse the entire instruction and construct the appropriate MCInst, or emit an error. On success, the entire line should be parsed up to and including the end-of-statement token. On failure, the parser is not required to read to the end of the line. 
<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Name">- The instruction name.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="NameLoc">- The source location of the name.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Operands">&#91;out&#93; - The list of parsed operands, this returns ownership of them to the caller.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
True on failure.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/ve/lib/target/ve/asmparser/veasmparser-cpp/#l00059">59</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/ve/lib/target/ve/asmparser/veasmparser-cpp">VEAsmParser.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### tryParseRegister {#a706dbdb05d45d2a4ca4051686d8f854c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ParseStatus VEAsmParser::tryParseRegister (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcregister">MCRegister</a> &amp; Reg, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smloc">SMLoc</a> &amp; StartLoc, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smloc">SMLoc</a> &amp; EndLoc)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
tryParseRegister - parse one register if possible

Check whether a register specification can be parsed at the current location, without failing the entire parse if it can&#39;t. Must not consume tokens if the parse fails.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/ve/lib/target/ve/asmparser/veasmparser-cpp/#l00057">57</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/ve/lib/target/ve/asmparser/veasmparser-cpp">VEAsmParser.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### validateTargetOperandClass {#a9521f45df206ea1af3e954b1b6520168}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned VEAsmParser::validateTargetOperandClass (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcparsedasmoperand">MCParsedAsmOperand</a> &amp; Op, unsigned Kind)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Allow a target to add special case operand matching for things that tblgen doesn&#39;t/can&#39;t handle effectively.

For example, literal immediates on ARM. TableGen expects a token operand, but the parser will recognize them as immediates.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/ve/lib/target/ve/asmparser/veasmparser-cpp/#l00063">63</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/ve/lib/target/ve/asmparser/veasmparser-cpp">VEAsmParser.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
